10 Types of Haskellers

published Sat May 01 2021| 1 minute read | Written by Euler

« Back

There are many stereotypes about people who program in haskell, and in this blog post I will list 10 of the most common types of haskellers. Many of you coworkers and maybe classmates fall into these categories. For each type of haskeller, I will include a code snippet that the person would write.

1. The C programmer

This is a person who programs in haskell as if it were C or C++. Here is how he would map a list

-- multiply each element in a list by 5

main:: IO()

main = do

 -- Create a new 256-size mutable vector

 -- Fill the vector with zeros

mutable <- M.replicate 256 1

forM_ ([1..256] z->

        modify mutable (x->x*5) z

)
